column4: Vodafone reports its first-quarter earnings on Friday, July 24, 2015.

3M reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.99 per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from $2.07. Analysts are expecting earnings of $7.92 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts project revenue to fall 4% year-over-year to $7.83 billion for the quarter, after being $8.13 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $31.14 billion.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the first quarter ended a streak of revenue growth that had lasted three quarters.

PulteGroup reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 26 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 27 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.27 per share. Revenue is projected to be $1.37 billion for the quarter, 7% above the year-earlier total of $1.29 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $6.15 billion.Revenue dropped year-over-year in the first quarter, breaking the three-quarter streak of revenue growth.

Verisign reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015.For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.79 per share. Revenue is projected to be 5% above the year-earlier total of $250.4 million at $261.9 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $1.05 billion.While the company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, income has fallen year-over-year by an average of 14% over the past four quarters. The quarter hit the hardest was the fourth quarter, that saw a 78% drop.

Bemis reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 68 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.58 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 15% year-over-year to $1.05 billion for the quarter, after being $1.24 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.19 billion.Revenue has fallen for the past three quarters. In the first quarter, revenue declined 16% to $1.04 billion while the figure fell 14% in the fourth quarter from the year earlier and 13% in the third quarter.Over the last four quarters, revenue has fallen an average of 12% year-over-year. The biggest drop came in the most recent quarter, when revenue fell 16% from the year-earlier quarter.

Whirlpool reports its second-quarter earnings on Wednesday, July 22, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $2.67 per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was $3.27. Analysts are expecting earnings of $12.32 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $5.29 billion for the quarter, 13% higher than the year-earlier total of $4.68 billion. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $21.92 billion.Over the last four quarters, the company's revenue rose by an average of 6% year-over-year. The largest growth was in the fourth quarter, when revenue climbed 18% year-over-year.

Amphenol reports its second-quarter earnings on Wednesday, July 22, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 57 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 61 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.44 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $1.31 billion by 3%, finishing at $1.35 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $5.59 billion.The company's profit has been on the rise for three quarters in a row. The 3% year-over-year growth in net income in the most recent quarter came after the 15% profit growth in the fourth quarter and the 13% rise in the third quarter.The company has seen revenue grow for three quarters straight. In the first quarter, revenue rose 1% to $1.33 billion while the figure rose 15% in the fourth quarter from the year earlier and 18% in the third quarter.

eBay reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 16, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 58 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.63 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $4.37 billion by 3%, finishing at $4.49 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $18.73 billion.Revenue rose in each of the last three quarters. The 2% revenue increase brought the figure up to $4.45 billion in the most recent quarter. Looking back further, revenue increased 9% in the fourth quarter from the year earlier and 12% in the third quarter.

KeyCorp reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 16, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 28 cents per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has increased from three months ago when it was 27 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.12 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $1.09 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 4% year-over-year to $1.05 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.23 billion.

Google reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 16, 2015.Revenue is expected to be $17.26 billion for the quarter, 8% higher than the year-earlier total of $15.96 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $74.23 billion.Over the last four quarters, the company has seen an average of 12% year-over-year growth in income. The biggest rise came in the fourth quarter, with income growing 41% from the year-ago quarter.Over the last four quarters, revenue rose 10% on average year-over-year. The biggest boost came in the second quarter, when revenue increased 13% from the year-ago quarter.The majority of analysts (100%) rate Google as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of nine similar companies, which average 62% buys. All six analysts rate Google as a buy.

CSX reports its second-quarter earnings on Tuesday, July 14, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 53 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 58 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.03 per share. Analysts project revenue to fall 4% year-over-year to $3.12 billion for the quarter, after being $3.24 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $12.42 billion.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the first quarter ended a streak of revenue growth that had lasted three quarters.The decrease in profit in the first quarter broke a streak of two consecutive quarters of year-over-year profit increases. Net income fell 16% in the first quarter while the figure rose 21% in the fourth quarter and 10% in the third quarter.

TiVo reports its first-quarter earnings on Tuesday, May 26, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is seven cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was nine cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of 39 cents per share. A year after being $107.1 million, analysts expect revenue to fall 15% year-over-year to $91.4 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $383.2 million.

NVIDIA reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, May 7, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 26 cents per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has increased from three months ago when it was 24 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.20 per share. Revenue is projected to be 6% above the year-earlier total of $1.10 billion at $1.17 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.91 billion.For three quarters in a row, the company's reported revenue has been on the rise. The 13% revenue increase brought the figure up to $1.25 billion in the most recent quarter. Looking back further, revenue increased 16% in the third quarter from the year earlier and 13% in the second quarter.The company's net income has been increasing for three consecutive quarters. In the fourth quarter, net income rose 41% while it rose 46% in the third quarter and 33% in the second quarter.

Fiserv reports its first-quarter earnings on Tuesday, May 5, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 86 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.79 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $1.23 billion by 5%, finishing at $1.29 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $5.33 billion.Over the last four quarters, the company has seen its revenue grow by an average of 6% year-over-year. The 7% increase in the first quarter was the biggest rise.For three straight quarters, the company has seen net income rise. In the most recent quarter, net income rose by 8% from the year-earlier period. Net income rose 50% in the quarter before that, and 10% in the second quarter.

DaVita reports its first-quarter earnings on Monday, May 4, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 85 cents per share.Over the past month, the consensus estimate has fallen from 86 cents, but it's still up from the consensus estimate of 84 cents three months ago. Analysts are expecting earnings of $3.74 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $3.04 billion by 7%, finishing at $3.25 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $13.58 billion.The company has reported increasing profit in the past two quarters. In the most recent quarter, net income rose by 13% from the year-earlier period. In the quarter before that, net income rose 35% year-over-year.

Aon reports its first-quarter earnings on Friday, May 1, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.29 per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from $1.37. Analysts are projecting earnings of $6.10 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease slightly year-over-year to $2.94 billion for the quarter, after being $2.95 billion a year ago. Analysts are projecting that revenue will stay flat at $2.94 billion this quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $12.43 billion.The 41% profit increase in the fourth quarter positioned the company at its fourth consecutive quarter of double-digit year-over-year profit growth. Over that time period, the fourth was also the biggest profit spike.

Airgas reports its fourth-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 30, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.14 per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was $1.33. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $4.85 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $1.27 billion by 3%, finishing at $1.31 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $5.31 billion.Over the last four quarters, the company has seen its income grow by an average of 4% year-over-year. The 5% increase in the most recent quarter was the biggest rise.Revenue has gone up for three straight quarters. The 5% revenue increase brought the figure up to $1.33 billion in the most recent quarter. Looking back further, revenue increased 6% in the second quarter from the year earlier and 3% in the first quarter.

IMAX reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 30, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is zero cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has sagged from two cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of 92 cents per share. Revenue is projected to be 13% above the year-earlier total of $48.2 million at $54.3 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $346.6 million.For three straight quarters, the company has seen net income rise. In the most recent quarter, net income rose by 3526% from the year-earlier period. Net income rose more than threefold in the quarter before that, and 13% in the second quarter.Revenue rose for the past two quarters in a row. In the most recent quarter, revenue rose more than twofold year-over-year to $102.5 million. The quarter before that, it rose 17%.The majority of analysts (60%) rate IMAX as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of four similar companies, which average 45% buys.IMAX is an entertainment technology company, specializing in motion picture technologies and large-format motion picture presentations. Discovery Communications, also in the motion pictures industry, will report earnings on Tuesday, May 5, 2015. Analysts are expecting earnings of 36 cents per share for Discovery, down 52% from last year's earnings of 75 cents per share.

Invesco reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 30, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 60 cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has fallen from 63 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.63 per share. After being $1.27 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 30% year-over-year to $894.3 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $3.72 billion.Over the last four quarters, income rose 19% on average year-over-year. The biggest boost came in the most recent quarter, when income increased 44% from the year-ago quarter.Revenue rose in the past two quarters. In the fourth quarter, revenue increased 1% to $1.28 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the third quarter, the figure rose 12%.

BorgWarnerÂ reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 30, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 84 cents per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from 87 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.43 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 3% above the year-earlier total of $2.08 billion at $2.14 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $8.57 billion.Revenue dropped year-over-year in the fourth quarter, breaking the three-quarter streak of revenue growth.Profit has dropped year-over-year in each of the last two quarters. The company posted profit falling by 12% in the fourth quarter. This is after it reported a profit decline in the third quarter by less than a percent.

PerkinElmer reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 30, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 46 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 52 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.61 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be $537.9 million for the quarter, 1% above the year-earlier total of $531.9 million. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $2.31 billion.Over the last four quarters, revenue has increased 6% on average year-over-year. The biggest increase came in the most recent quarter, when revenue rose 14% from the year-earlier quarter.The decline in profit in the fourth quarter followed three straight quarters of year-over-year profit growth. Profit dropped 10% year-over-year in the most recent quarter. Going further back, the figure rose 5% in the third quarter, 81% in the second quarter and 6% in the first quarter.

Bemis reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 58 cents per share.The consensus estimate is up from three months ago when it was 57 cents, but hasn't changed over the past month. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.56 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 16% year-over-year to $1.04 billion for the quarter, after being $1.24 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $4.19 billion.For the past three quarters, the company has reported decreasing revenue. Revenue in the fourth quarter fell 15% year-over-year to $1.05 billion. The figure dropped 13% in the third quarter and 4% in the second quarter.The profit increase in the fourth quarter followed a decline in net income in the previous quarter. In the fourth quarter, net income rose 20% to $59.1 million. In the third quarter, net income fell 69%.

KeyCorp reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 16, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 26 cents per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.13 per share. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 3% year-over-year to $1.03 billion for the quarter, after being $1.07 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.27 billion.

Carnival reports its first-quarter earnings on Friday, March 27, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is nine cents per share.Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.52 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be $3.57 billion for the quarter, 26% above the year-earlier total of $2.83 billion. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $15.99 billion.Carnival's loss in the last quarter came after two previous quarters of profit.

Accenture reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, March 26, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.07 per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $4.75 per share. Analysts project revenue to fall 2% year-over-year to $7.38 billion for the quarter, after being $7.57 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $30.61 billion.The company's profit has been growing for the past three quarters. In the first quarter, net income rose 24% while it rose 4% in the fourth quarter and 1% in the third quarter.The majority of analysts (53%) rate Accenture as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of six similar companies, which average 38% buys.

Diebold reports its fourth-quarter earnings on Thursday, February 12, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 52 cents per share.Despite not changing over the past month, the consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 53 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $1.77 per share. Revenue is projected to be 7% above the year-earlier total of $811.4 million at $869.9 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $3.06 billion.

V.F. Corporation reports its second-quarter earnings on Friday, July 24, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 36 cents per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $3.21 per share. Revenue is projected to be 2% above the year-earlier total of $2.40 billion at $2.46 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $12.68 billion.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 10%. The biggest boost for the company came in the most recent quarter, when profit jumped by 83%.The majority of analysts (78%) rate V.F as a buy. That percentage is still below the mean analyst rating of three similar companies, which average 100% buys.V.F. is an apparel company that designs and manufactures or sources from independent contractors a variety of apparel and footwear for all ages. Cherokee Inc., also in the apparel/accessories industry, will report earnings on Thursday, September 10, 2015. Analysts are expecting earnings of 24 cents per share for Cherokee, down 11% from last year's earnings of 27 cents per share.

AT&T reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 63 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 64 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.51 per share. Revenue is expected to be $33.04 billion for the quarter, 1% higher than the year-earlier total of $32.58 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $133.62 billion.

Dunkin' Brands reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 48 cents per share.Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.91 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $203.6 million for the quarter, 7% higher than the year-earlier total of $190.9 million. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $799.8 million.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the first quarter broke a three-quarter streak of revenue increases.A two-quarter streak of rising net income was broken by the profit decrease in the first quarter. The 45% year-over-year profit decline in the first quarter can be compared with the increases in previous quarters; profit rose 25% in the fourth quarter and 36% in the third quarter.Analysts are split on Dunkin, but nine of 20 analysts rate it hold.

Gentex Corporation reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 25 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 26 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.03 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $338.4 million by 11%, finishing at $375.6 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $1.52 billion.Over the last four quarters, the company's revenue rose by an average of 14% year-over-year. The largest growth was in the third quarter, when revenue climbed 22% year-over-year.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 20%. The company enjoyed the boost in the second quarter when net income expanded 47%, marking the biggest gain.The majority of analysts (62%) rate Gentex as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of 10 similar companies, which average 50% buys.

Credit Suisse reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015.For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.38 per share. Revenue is expected to be $33.05 billion for the quarter, 208% higher than the year-earlier total of $10.73 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $33.05 billion.

Boston Scientific reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 21 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 22 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of 90 cents per share. After being $1.87 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 2% year-over-year to $1.83 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $7.34 billion.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the first quarter ended a streak of revenue growth that had lasted three quarters.The majority of analysts (64%) rate Boston Scientific as a buy. That percentage is still below the mean analyst rating of 10 similar companies, which average 66% buys.

Republic Services reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 23, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 51 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 53 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.02 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $2.23 billion by 4%, finishing at $2.31 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $9.14 billion.A drop in revenue in the first quarter came after three straight quarters of rising revenue.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 36%. The company benefited from the boost in the second quarter when profit swelled more than threefold, marking the biggest gain.The majority of analysts (56%) rate Republic Services as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of eight similar companies, which average 53% buys.

Texas Instruments reports its second-quarter earnings on Wednesday, July 22, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 65 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 72 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.70 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 1% year-over-year to $3.26 billion for the quarter, after being $3.29 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $13.16 billion.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the first quarter broke a three-quarter streak of revenue increases.

Sony reports its third-quarter earnings on Wednesday, February 4, 2015.For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting a loss of $1.36 per share. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $75.41 billion.A drop in revenue in the second quarter came after three straight quarters of rising revenue.

Clorox reports its second-quarter earnings on Wednesday, February 4, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 90 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $4.48 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts project revenue to fall 2% year-over-year to $1.30 billion for the quarter, after being $1.33 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $5.55 billion.The company has seen net income fall in each of the last two quarters. In the first quarter, net income fell 22% from the year earlier quarter, while the figure dropped 7% in the fourth quarter.Over the last four quarters, revenue has fallen an average of 1% year-over-year. The biggest drop came in the fourth quarter, when revenue fell 2% from the year-earlier quarter.

Omnicom Group reports its second-quarter earnings on Tuesday, July 21, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.23 per share.The consensus estimate has increased over the past month, from $1.22, but it's below the estimate of $1.24 from three months ago. Analysts are expecting earnings of $4.35 per share for the fiscal year. After being $3.87 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 3% year-over-year to $3.76 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $15.10 billion.Revenue fell year-over-year in the first quarter, snapping the three-quarter streak of rising revenue.The company has been reaping profit in the past eight quarters, and for the last four, it has seen an average of 3% growth in profit year-over-year. The company benefited from the 24% growth in the third quarter, which was its quarter with the biggest gain.

Linear Technology reports its fourth-quarter earnings on Tuesday, July 21, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 56 cents per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.14 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $365.4 million by 5%, finishing at $385.4 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $1.48 billion.The company has been reaping profit in the past eight quarters, and for the last four, it has seen an average of 17% growth in profit year-over-year. The biggest gain came in the fourth quarter with a 27% surge.

Unum reports its fourth-quarter earnings on Tuesday, February 3, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 88 cents per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was 91 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $3.52 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be $2.70 billion for the quarter, 4% above the year-earlier total of $2.59 billion. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $10.53 billion.The profit drop in the third quarter followed two consecutive quarters of increasing net income. The less than a percent profit drop in the most recent quarter can be compared with two previous quarters of profit growth: 11% in the second quarter and 8% in the first quarter.The company's revenue has risen for two straight quarters. In the most recent quarter, revenue rose 1% year-over-year to $2.61 billion. The quarter before that, it rose 2%.

Airgas reports its third-quarter earnings on Tuesday, February 3, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.23 per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from $1.24. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $5.04 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $1.24 billion by 5%, finishing at $1.31 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $5.34 billion.Over the last four quarters, income has increased 7% on average year-over-year. In the most recent quarter, the company saw its greatest gain in income, when it increased 19% from the year-earlier quarter.

Genuine Parts reports its second-quarter earnings on Monday, July 20, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.32 per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was $1.34. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $4.77 per share. Revenue is expected to be $4.05 billion for the quarter, 4% higher than the year-earlier total of $3.91 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $15.84 billion.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the first quarter broke a three-quarter streak of revenue increases.The drop in net income in the first quarter snapped a streak of two straight quarters of year-over-year profit growth. The 19% profit drop in the most recent quarter can be compared with two previous quarters of profit growth: 10% in the fourth quarter and 10% in the third quarter.The majority of analysts (62%) rate Genuine as a buy. That percentage is still below the mean analyst rating of three similar companies, which average 91% buys.Genuine Parts Company distributes automotive replacement parts, industrial replacement parts, office products and electrical/electronic materials. Dorman Products Inc., also in the auto and truck parts industry, will report earnings on Wednesday, July 29, 2015. Analysts are expecting earnings of $0.69 per share for Dorman Products, up 8% from last year's earnings of $0.64 per share.

SunTrust Banks reports its second-quarter earnings on Friday, July 17, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 81 cents per share.Over the past month, the consensus estimate has fallen, from 82 cents, but it's the same as it was three months ago. Analysts are expecting earnings of $3.26 per share for the fiscal year. After being $2.30 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 12% year-over-year to $2.02 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $8.11 billion.

Charles Schwab reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 16, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 24 cents per share.Despite not changing over the past month, the consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 25 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.04 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 3% above the year-earlier total of $1.50 billion at $1.54 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $6.38 billion.The fall in profit in the first quarter followed a profit increase in the previous quarter. Net income dropped in the most recent quarter by 7% to $302 million. The quarter prior to that, net income rose 10%.The majority of analysts (60%) rate Charles Schwab as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of seven similar companies, which average 57% buys.

Travelzoo Inc. reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 16, 2015.Analysts look for revenue to decrease 8% year-over-year to $33.8 million for the quarter, after being $36.9 million a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $133.1 million.Revenue has fallen in the past two quarters. In the first quarter, revenue declined 1% to $36.5 million from the year earlier quarter. In the fourth quarter, the figure fell 16%.

Torchmark reports its fourth-quarter earnings on Monday, February 2, 2015, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.00 per share.Analysts are expecting earnings of $4.02 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be $978.9 million for the quarter, 5% above the year-earlier total of $930.6 million. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $3.90 billion.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, but income has been sliding year-over-year by an average of 1% over the last four quarters. The company was hit the hardest in the most recent quarter as its net income dropped by 7%.

NEW YORK, NY - JULY 10: Actor Dwayne Johnson attends the 'Skyscraper' New York premiere at AMC Loews Lincoln Square on July 10, 2018 in New York City. The 35% year-over-year growth in net income in the most recent quarter came after the 26% profit growth in the second quarter and the 12% rise in the first quarter.

Tiffany & Co. reports its second-quarter earnings on Wednesday, August 27, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 86 cents per share.The consensus estimate has risen from three months ago when it was 85 cents. It hasn't been adjusted since. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $4.28 per share. Revenue is expected to be $987.9 million for the quarter, 7% higher than the year-earlier total of $925.9 million. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $4.39 billion.Over the last four quarters, revenue rose 6% on average year-over-year. The biggest boost came in the most recent quarter, when revenue increased 9% from the year-ago quarter.

McDonald's reports its fourth-quarter earnings on Thursday, January 23, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.39 per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was $1.40. Analysts are projecting earnings of $5.56 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 2% above the year-earlier total of $6.95 billion at $7.11 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $28.13 billion.The company's net income has been growing for three straight quarters. In the third quarter, net income rose 9% while it rose 4% in the second quarter and slightly in the first quarter.Over the last four quarters, the company has seen its revenue grow by an average of 3% year-over-year. The 5% increase in the most recent quarter was the biggest rise.

JDS Uniphase reports its fourth-quarter earnings on Tuesday, August 12, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is seven cents per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of 31 cents per share. Revenue is projected to be 4% above the year-earlier total of $421.3 million at $437.1 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $1.73 billion.JDS Uniphase's loss in the most recent quarter came after two previous quarters of profitability.Revenue was down in the third quarter after rising in the previous quarter. Revenue dropped 1% to $418 million in the third quarter from the year earlier. In the second quarter, revenue rose 4%.The majority of analysts (54%) rate JDS Uniphase as a buy. That percentage is still below the mean analyst rating of seven similar companies, which average 60% buys.

Computer Sciences reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, August 7, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 94 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 99 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $13 billion.A year-over-year revenue growth in the fourth quarter broke a three-quarter streak of declining revenue.

Cardinal Health reports its fourth-quarter earnings on Monday, August 4, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 81 cents per share.Over the past month, the consensus estimate has risen from 80 cents, but it's below the estimate of 84 cents from three months ago. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $3.82 per share. Analysts project revenue to fall 14% year-over-year to $21.88 billion for the quarter, after being $25.42 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $90.23 billion.For the last four quarters, the company has reported decreasing revenue. Revenue in the third quarter was $21.43 billion, a drop of 16% year-over-year. Revenue dropped 12% in the second quarter, fell 5% in the first quarter and 5% in the fourth quarter.The majority of analysts (85%) rate Cardinal Health as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of 10 similar companies, which average 60% buys.
Tenet Healthcare reports its second-quarter earnings on Monday, August 4, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is zero cents per share.

The largest growth was in the most recent quarter, when revenue climbed 47% year-over-year.Hecla Mining's profit this past quarter came after two consecutive quarters of losses.

For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $3.03 billion.The revenue decrease in the first quarter came after two quarters of increasing revenue.Net income has decreased in each of the last two quarters. In the most recent quarter, profit dipped 16% year-over-year, and the figure dropped 41% in the fourth quarter.Analysts are split on DENTSPLY, but four of 10 analysts rate it hold.

Colgate-Palmolive reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, July 31, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 73 cents per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.99 per share. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $17.74 billion.Revenue fell year-over-year in the first quarter, snapping the three-quarter streak of rising revenue.The company has seen net income fall in each of the last two quarters. The company posted profit falling by 31% in the first quarter. This is after it reported a profit decline in the fourth quarter by 6%.

The hardest-hit quarter for the company was the fourth quarter, in which profit dove 27%.The last three quarters have brought the company decreased revenue. The year-over-year drop in revenue was 3% in the first quarter. Prior to that, revenue fell less than a percent in the fourth quarter and 1% in the third quarter year-over-year.

For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $8.35 billion.Revenue has declined in the past two quarters. In the first quarter, revenue declined 7% to $2.17 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the fourth quarter, the figure fell 20%.

In the most recent quarter, revenue rose 4% year-over-year to $1.23 billion. The quarter before that, it rose 2%.

In the most recent quarter, profit dipped 13% year-over-year, and the figure dropped 20% in the second quarter.Revenue has climbed in each of the last three quarters. The 3% revenue increase brought the figure up to $2.50 billion in the most recent quarter. Looking back further, revenue increased 11% in the second quarter from the year earlier and 17% in the first quarter.

The biggest boost came in the most recent quarter, when income increased more than twofold from the year-ago quarter.The company has reported revenue growth for three quarters in a row. In the third quarter, revenue rose 11% to $2.82 billion while the figure rose 13% in the second quarter from the year earlier and 8% in the first quarter.

The 2% revenue increase brought the figure up to $864.5 million in the most recent quarter. Looking back further, revenue increased 2% in the third quarter from the year earlier and 9% in the second quarter.

In the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, net income rose 2.7%, while the figure dropped 11.7% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 12.9% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.

Analysts foresee 

Broadcom
 (BRCM) announcing decreased profits on Tuesday, April 23, 2013, when it reports its first quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are projecting Broadcom to come in with earnings of 35 cents per share, down 5.4% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 37 cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has fallen from 38 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $1.95 per share. Revenue is expected to be $1.91 billion for the quarter, 4.5% higher than the year-earlier total of $1.83 billion. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $8.45 billion.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, but income has been sliding year-over-year by an average of 22.4% over the last four quarters. The company was hit the hardest in the first quarter of the last fiscal year as its net income dropped by 61.4%.The majority of analysts (85.7%) rate Broadcom as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest eight competitors, which average 40.8% buys. Analyst sentiment has improved recently, as the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.

Analysts expect decreased profit for PACCAR (PCAR) when the company reports its first quarter results on Tuesday, April 23, 2013. Although PACCAR reported profit of 91 cents a year ago, the consensus estimate calls for earnings per share of 68 cents.The consensus estimate has moved down from 70 cents over the past three months. Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.18 per share for the fiscal year. After being $4.51 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 18.5% year-over-year to $3.68 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $16.15 billion.Net income has decreased in each of the last two quarters. The company posted profit falling by 22.6% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year. This is after it reported a profit decline in the third quarter of the last fiscal year by 17%.Revenue has dropped in the past two quarters. In fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, revenue was $4.8 billion, 1.1% lower than the year-ago figure. In the quarter before that, revenue fell 16.7%.
Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on PACCAR, with 11 of 18 analysts rating it hold. That rating hasn't budged in three months as the average analyst rating of the stock has remained constant.

After 

Netflix
 (NFLX) took a loss of 8 cents a year ago, analysts think when the company reports this year's first quarter numbers on Monday, April 22, 2013, the results will be a lot better. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $1.17 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $869.8 million by 17.3%, finishing at $1.02 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.26 billion.

Hasbro
 (HAS) reports its first quarter earnings on Monday, April 22, 2013.Analysts look for revenue to decrease 1.6% year-over-year to $638.8 million for the quarter, after being $648.9 million a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.09 billion.

Halliburton
 (HAL) announcing decreased profits on Monday, April 22, 2013, when it reports its first quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are expecting Halliburton to come in with earnings of 58 cents per share, 34.8% less than a year ago when it reported earnings of 89 cents per share.The consensus estimate has declined from 60 cents over the past three months. Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.02 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $6.87 billion by 0.3%, finishing at $6.89 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $29.59 billion.For three consecutive quarters, the company has seen net income decrease. In fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, net income fell 26.2% from the year earlier, while the figure fell 11.9% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 0.3% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts (80.8%) rate Halliburton as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 67.8% buys. Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months.

Expectations have dropped for 

Caterpillar
's (CAT) first quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Monday, April 22, 2013. The consensus analyst estimate has dropped from $1.48 a share to the current estimate of earnings of $1.34 a share.Current Wall Street estimates reflect a 43.5% decline from the year-ago quarter, when the company reported earnings of $2.37 per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from $1.80. Analysts are expecting earnings of $7.83 per share for the fiscal year. After being $15.98 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 13.6% year-over-year to $13.81 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $63.16 billion.A year-over-year revenue decrease in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year snapped a streak of three consecutive quarters of revenue increases. The 6.8% revenue decline in the most recent quarter can be compared with three quarters prior when it had been rising. It increased 4.6%in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 22.1% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 23.4% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.The profit dip in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year came after three consecutive quarters of rising profit. Net income fell 54.9% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year from the year earlier, while the figure rose 48.9% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 67.4% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 29.5% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.

Honeywell (HON) reports its first quarter earnings on Friday, April 19, 2013.The consensus estimate is $1.14 per share, up 9.6% from a year ago when Honeywell reported earnings of $1.04 per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has risen from $1.13. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $39.38 billion.

Analysts are looking for decreased profit for SAP (SAP) when the company reports its results for the first quarter on Friday, April 19, 2013. SAP reported profit of 64 cents a year ago, but the consensus estimate calls for earnings per share of 53 cents this time around.The consensus estimate has dipped over the past three months from 56 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.82 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 14.8% year-over-year to $3.8 billion for the quarter, after being $4.46 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $18.11 billion.Net income increased in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, snapping a two-quarter streak of falling profit. In the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, net income rose 3.6%, while the figure dropped 52.6% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 1.4% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.Most analysts think investors should stand pat on SAP, with 12 of 19 analysts rating it hold. Analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.

McDonald's (MCD) reports its first quarter earnings on Friday, April 19, 2013.Analysts are expecting McDonald's to report earnings of $1.27 per share, up 3.3% from a year ago when it reported earnings of $1.23 per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $5.78 per share. Revenue is projected to be 0.7% above the year-earlier total of $6.55 billion at $6.59 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $28.75 billion.The increase in profit in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year broke a streak of two consecutive quarters of year-over-year profit decreases. In the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, net income rose 1.4%, while the figure dropped 3.5% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 4.5% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.Over the last four quarters, the company has seen an average of 2.2% year-over-year growth in revenue. The biggest rise came in the first quarter of the last fiscal year, with revenue growing 7.1% from the year-ago quarter.

Schlumberger (SLB) reports its first quarter earnings on Friday, April 19, 2013.The consensus estimate is 99 cents per share, up 1% from a year ago when Schlumberger reported earnings of 98 cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has sagged from $1.02. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $4.70 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $10.61 billion by 1.3%, finishing at $10.75 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $46.01 billion.The profit dip in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year came after three consecutive quarters of rising profit. Net income fell 3.5% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year from the year earlier, while the figure rose 9.5% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 4.8% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 37.8% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts (88.5%) rate Schlumberger as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest seven competitors, which average 63.4% buys. Schlumberger's average analyst rating hasn't changed over the past three months.

In the month leading up to the Blackstone Group's (BX) first quarter earnings announcement slated for Thursday, April 18, 2013, expectations have risen for the upcoming results. The consensus analyst estimate has gone from 52 cents per share to the current projection of earnings of 55 cents per share.The current estimate reflects a 41% increase from a year ago, when the company reported earnings of 39 cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has increased from 48 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.26 per share for the fiscal year. After being $1.24 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 6.5% year-over-year to $1.16 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $5.05 billion.For the past three quarters, the company's reported revenue has been declining. In fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, revenue declined 32% to $1.07 billion while the figure fell more than fourfold in third quarter of the last fiscal year from the year earlier and 29% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts (80%) rate Blackstone as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 59.4% buys. Analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.

PepsiCo (PEP) reports its first quarter earnings on Thursday, April 18, 2013.Analysts are expecting PepsiCo to report earnings of 71 cents per share, up 2.9% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 69 cents per share.The consensus estimate has declined from 73 cents over the past three months. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $4.39 per share. Revenue is expected to be $12.61 billion for the quarter, 1.5% higher than the year-earlier total of $12.43 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $68 billion.The profit growth in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year followed three straight quarters of falling profits. In the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, net income rose 17.4% from the year earlier, while the figure dropped 4.9% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 21.1% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 1.4% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.Revenue has dipped in each of the last three quarters. The year-over-year drop in revenue was 1% in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year. Prior to that, revenue fell 5.3% in third quarter of the last fiscal year and 2.2% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year year-over-year.

Danaher (DHR) reports its first quarter earnings on Thursday, April 18, 2013.The Wall Street consensus is 76 cents per share, up 4.1% from a year ago when Danaher reported earnings of 73 cents per share.The consensus estimate has declined from 79 cents over the past three months. Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.45 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 4.3% above the year-earlier total of $4.32 billion at $4.5 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $19.09 billion.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 12.6%. The biggest gain came in the first quarter of the last fiscal year with a 42.8% surge.Over the last four quarters, revenue has increased 14.9% on average year-over-year. In the first quarter of the last fiscal year, the company say its greatest gain in revenue, when it increased 29% from the year-earlier quarter.

Leading up to Microsoft's (MSFT) announcement of its third quarter earnings on Thursday, April 18, 2013 analysts have become more wary as expectations have fallen over the past month to earnings of 74 cents per share from earnings of 77 cents per share.The current Wall Street consensus is 23.3% higher than the year-ago quarter, when the company reported earnings of 60 cents per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from 78 cents. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest nine competitors, which average 50% buys.

Expectations have dropped for Nucor's (NUE) first quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Thursday, April 18, 2013. The consensus analyst estimate has dropped from 41 cents a share to the current estimate of earnings of 26 cents a share.The current estimate is down 43.5% from the year-ago quarter, when the company reported earnings of 46 cents per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from 60 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.20 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $5.07 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 9.1% year-over-year to $4.61 billion for the quarter. The figure dropped 8.6% in third quarter of the last fiscal year and 0.1% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.While the company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, income has fallen year-over-year by an average of 27.8% over the past four quarters. The company was hit the hardest in the second quarter of the last fiscal year as its net income dropped by 62.5%.

Nokia (NOK) is expected to book a narrower loss than a year ago when it reports first quarter earnings on Thursday, April 18, 2013 with analysts expecting a loss of 6 cents per share, up from a loss of 11 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate has moved down from a loss of 5 cents over the past three months. Analysts are expecting earnings of one cent per share for the fiscal year. After being $9.79 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 11.7% year-over-year to $8.65 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $38.15 billion.Revenue has fallen in the past four quarters. Revenue dropped 22.4% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, fell 29% in second quarter of the last fiscal year and 33.6% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.Nokia saw profit in the last quarter, snapping a three-quarter streak of losses. The company reported a profit of $163.4 million in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, a loss of $1.25 billion in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, a loss of $1.79 billion in the second of the last fiscal year and a loss of $1.24 billion in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.

Analysts expect decreased profit for KeyCorp (KEY) when the company reports its first quarter results on Thursday, April 18, 2013. In the most recent quarter, revenue rose 4.7% year-over-year to $2.26 billion. The quarter before that, it rose 4%.The majority of analysts (66.7%) rate Mattel as a buy. Analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.

The company was hit the hardest in the second quarter of the last fiscal year as it saw profit drop by 94.8%.

Optimism surrounds Textron (TXT), as it gets ready to report its first quarter results on Wednesday, April 17, 2013. Expectations have dropped for Dover's (DOV) first quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Wednesday, April 17, 2013. Wall Street is high on Ebay (EBAY), expecting it to report earnings that are up 12.5% from a year ago when it reports its first quarter earnings on Wednesday, April 17, 2013. Revenue is expected to be $3.76 billion for the quarter, 14.7% higher than the year-earlier total of $3.28 billion. Profit dropped 62.1% year-over-year in the most recent quarter. Going further back, the figure rose 21.7% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, more than twofold in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 19.8% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.

In the month leading up to the BlackRock's (BLK) first quarter earnings announcement slated for Tuesday, April 16, 2013, expectations have risen for the upcoming results. Yahoo! (YHOO) reports its first quarter earnings on Tuesday, April 16, 2013.The Wall Street consensus is 25 cents per share, up 4.2% from a year ago when Yahoo! reported earnings of 24 cents per share.The consensus estimate has increased from 24 cents over the past month. Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.09 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $1.22 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 9.9% year-over-year to $1.1 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.58 billion.A growth in revenue in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year came after two consecutive quarters of falling revenue. Revenue rose 1.6% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and fell 1.2% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 0.9% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Yahoo!, with 16 of 27 analysts rating it hold. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $11.91 billion.Profit has decreased in each of the last two quarters. In fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, revenue declined 2.3% to $2.88 billion while the figure fell 2.3% in third quarter of the last fiscal year from the year earlier and 0.2% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts think investors should stand pat on CSX, with 13 of 25 analysts rating it hold. The average analyst rating of the stock has stayed steadfast from three months prior.

Intel (INTC) is expected to report poor first quarter earnings on Tuesday, April 16, 2013 with analysts expecting a 20.8% drop in earnings from a year ago. The consensus estimate is 42 cents per share, down from earnings of 53 cents per share a year ago.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has risen from 39 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $1.92 per share. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 2.1% year-over-year to $12.63 billion for the quarter, after being $12.91 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $53.77 billion.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, but income has been falling for the last four by an average of 14.6% year-over-year. In fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, revenue was $13.48 billion, 3% lower than the year-ago figure. In the quarter before that, revenue fell 5.5%.

Comerica (CMA) reports its first quarter earnings on Tuesday, April 16, 2013.The Wall Street consensus is 67 cents per share, up 1.5% from a year ago when Comerica reported earnings of 66 cents per share.The consensus estimate has increased from 63 cents over the past three months. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.73 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 8.9% year-over-year to $622.8 million for the quarter, after being $684 million a year ago. In fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, revenue was $660 million, 0.5% lower than the year-ago figure. In the quarter before that, revenue fell 1.1%.

Analysts have become increasingly bullish on Progressive (PGR) in the month leading up to the company's first quarter earnings announcement scheduled for Thursday, April 11, 2013. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $17.43 billion.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 0.1%. The biggest gain came in the third quarter of the last fiscal year with an 83.8% surge.Most analysts think investors should stand pat on Progressive, with nine of 18 analysts rating it hold.

Scripps Network Interactive reports its second-quarter earnings on Thursday, August 7, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.13 per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has fallen from $1.20. column6: Forbes Earnings Preview: Scripps Network Interactive

column4:
Pall
 reports its first quarter earnings on Tuesday, November 26, 2013, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 69 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 79 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $3.41 per share. After being $627.6 million a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop less than a percent year-over-year to $627.3 million for the quarter. Analysts are projecting that revenue this quarter will remain flat at $627.3 million. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $2.73 billion.Revenue grew in the fourth quarter, following a decrease in the quarter prior. Revenue rose 14% to $716.8 million in the fourth quarter from the year earlier. In the third quarter, revenue fell 3%.Over the last four quarters, the company's income rose by an average of 74% year-over-year. The largest growth was in the first quarter, when income climbed more than fourfold year-over-year.

Expeditors International of Washington reports its second-quarter earnings on Tuesday, August 5, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 47 cents per share.Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.88 per share for the fiscal year. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $6.44 billion.A year-over-year revenue decrease in the first quarter snapped a two-quarter streak of growing revenue.Profit has dropped year-over-year in each of the last two quarters. In the first quarter, net income fell 9% from the year earlier quarter, while the figure dropped 1% in the fourth quarter.Expeditors International of Washington offers global logistics services through an international network supporting the movement and strategic positioning of goods. UTi Worldwide, also in the misc. transportation industry, will report earnings on Friday, September 5, 2014. Analysts are expecting earnings of two cents per share for UTi Worldwide, down 60% from last year's earnings of five cents per share.

column4: Analysts expect disappointing news from RadioShack (RSH) when it reports its fourth quarter earnings on Tuesday, February 26, 2013. Wall Street is optimistic about priceline.com (PCLN), which is slated to report its fourth quarter results on Tuesday, February 26, 2013. Analysts project a profit of $6.17 a share, a rise from $4.91 per share a year ago.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was $6.19. Analysts are expecting earnings of $29.79 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $1.19 billion for the quarter, 20.1% higher than the year-earlier total of $990.8 million. Over that period, revenue has grown by an average of 25.4%. The biggest boost came in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year when revenue increased 35.5% year-over-year.The company's net income has been increasing for three consecutive quarters. In the most recent quarter, profit increased 27.1% year-over-year. Going back two quarters, net income rose 37.4% in the second quarter and 73.7% in the first quarter.
The majority of analysts (72.2%) rate priceline.com as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest seven competitors, which average 41.9% buys. Analysts have grown increasingly optimistic about the stock in the last three months.
