For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $7.39 billion.The company has posted increasing profit for three quarters in a row. In the most recent quarter, profit increased 7.7% year-over-year. Going back two quarters, net income rose 15.1% in the second quarter and 21.4% in the first quarter.The majority of analysts (79.3%) rate MasterCard as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 52.4% buys. Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months.

Bemis (BMS) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Thursday, January 31, 2013.The consensus estimate is 49 cents per share, up 8.9% from a year ago when Bemis reported earnings of 45 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.12 per share for the fiscal year. After being $1.27 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 3.2% year-over-year to $1.23 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $5.14 billion.The company's reported revenue has declined in each of the last three quarters. The year-over-year drop in revenue was 5.2% in third quarter. Prior to that, revenue fell 4.2% in second quarter and 1.5% in the first quarter year-over-year.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, but income has been falling for the last four by an average of 27.1% year-over-year. The company was hit the hardest in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year as its net income dropped by 57.3%.

Despite an expected dip in profit, analysts are generally optimistic about Aetna (AET) as it prepares to reports its fourth quarter earnings on Thursday, January 31, 2013.Analysts are projecting Aetna to come in with earnings of 96 cents per share, down 1% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 97 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $5.13 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $8.97 billion for the quarter, 1.9% higher than the year-earlier total of $8.8 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $35.56 billion.Net income increased in the third quarter, snapping a two-quarter streak of falling profit. In the most recent quarter, profit rose 1.8%. For two quarters prior, the figure dropped 14.7% in the second quarter and 12.8% in the first quarter.The majority of analysts (61.1%) rate Aetna as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 44.8% buys. Analyst sentiment has waned during the last three months.

Wall Street is expecting higher profit for QUALCOMM (QCOM) when the company reports its first quarter results on Wednesday, January 30, 2013. The consensus estimate is calling for profit of $1 a share, a rise from 85 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate is up from three months ago when it was 89 cents, but hasn't changed over the past month. Analysts are expecting earnings of $3.80 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $5.9 billion for the quarter, 26% higher than the year-earlier total of $4.68 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $23.66 billion.In each of the last four quarters, the company has seen double-digit year-over-year revenue growth. Over that time span, revenue has increased by an average of 28.3%, with the largest growth in the first quarter of the last fiscal year when it rose 39.8% year-over-year.The company's profit has been growing for the past three quarters. In the most recent quarter, net income rose by 20.4% from the year-earlier period. Net income rose 16.6% in the quarter before that, and more than twofold in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.

Bed Bath & Beyond reports its first-quarter earnings on Wednesday, June 25, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 95 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was $1.03, but is unchanged over the past month. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $5.06 per share. Revenue is projected to be $2.69 billion for the quarter, 3% above the year-earlier total of $2.61 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $11.95 billion.The company's net income has been increasing for three consecutive quarters. The 65% year-over-year growth in net income in the most recent quarter came after the 2% profit growth in the third quarter and the 11% rise in the second quarter.Revenue has climbed for three consecutive quarters. In the fourth quarter, revenue rose 23% to $3.20 billion while the figure rose 6% in the third quarter from the year earlier and 9% in the second quarter.
column6: Forbes Earnings Preview: Bed Bath & Beyond

column4: Analysts are looking for decreased profit for Harris (HRS) when the company reports its results for the second quarter on Tuesday, January 29, 2013. Harris reported profit of $1.22 a year ago, but the consensus estimate calls for earnings per share of $1.20 this time around.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was $1.23. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $5.15 per share. Analysts project revenue to fall 9.4% year-over-year to $1.31 billion for the quarter, after being $1.45 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $5.42 billion.The company has seen declines in revenue in the past two quarters. In first quarter, revenue declined 13.6% to $1.26 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, the figure fell 35.3%.Most analysts think investors should stand pat on Harris, with eight of 10 analysts rating it hold. That rating hasn't budged in three months as the average analyst rating of the stock has remained unchanged.

Expectations have dropped for Hess' (HES) fourth quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Wednesday, January 30, 2013. The consensus analyst estimate has dropped from $1.40 a share to the current estimate of earnings of $1.28 a share.Analysts' estimates are up 9.4% from the year-ago quarter, when Hess reported earnings of $1.17 per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from $1.47. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $5.98 per share. Revenue is projected to be 3.3% above the year-earlier total of $9.32 billion at $9.63 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $37.96 billion.Revenue rose year-over-year in the third quarter, breaking a two-quarter streak of declining revenue. Revenue rose 9.8% in the third quarter and fell 5.5% in the second quarter and 7.7% in the first quarter.The majority of analysts (64.7%) rate Hess as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest eight competitors, which average 58.5% buys. There has been a decrease in optimism about the stock among analysts over the last three months. Even so, over the past quarter, the stock price has increased from $53.24 on October 29, 2012 to $58.44.

Analysts foresee Boeing (BA) announcing decreased profits on Wednesday, January 30, 2013, when it reports its fourth quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are projecting Boeing to come in with earnings of $1.19 per share, down 9.2% from a year ago when it reported earnings of $1.31 per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has increased from $1.16. Analysts are projecting earnings of $5 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $19.55 billion by 14.3%, finishing at $22.36 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $81.72 billion.In each of the last four quarters, the company has seen double-digit year-over-year revenue growth. Over that time span, revenue has increased by an average of 20.5%, with the largest growth in the first quarter when it rose 30% year-over-year.The profit dip in the third quarter came after three consecutive quarters of rising profit. Net income fell 6% in the third quarter from the year earlier, while the figure rose 2.8% in the second quarter, 57.5% in the first quarter and 19.7% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.

Analysts foresee MeadWestvaco (MWV) announcing decreased profits on Wednesday, January 30, 2013, when it reports its fourth quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are projecting MeadWestvaco to come in with earnings of 19 cents per share, down 26.9% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 26 cents per share.The consensus estimate is up from three months ago when it was 18 cents, but hasn't changed over the past month. Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.38 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $1.5 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 11.3% year-over-year to $1.33 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $5.52 billion.Revenue has been falling the past two quarters. In third quarter, revenue was $1.4 billion, 14.9% lower than the year-ago figure. In the quarter before that, revenue fell 8.6%.

ConocoPhillips (COP) is expected to report poor fourth quarter earnings on Wednesday, January 30, 2013 with analysts expecting a 30.2% drop in earnings from a year ago. The consensus estimate is $1.41 per share, down from earnings of $2.02 per share a year ago.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has increased from three months ago when it was $1.40. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $5.93 per share. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 78.5% year-over-year to $13.31 billion for the quarter, after being $62 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $100.07 billion.The company's reported declining profits in the last three quarters. In third quarter, net income fell 31.3% from the year earlier, while the figure fell 33.4% in the second quarter and 3% in the first quarter.Revenue has declined in the past two quarters. Revenue dropped by 76% year-over-year to $15.09 billion in third quarter. The quarter before that, revenue dropped 76.9%.Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months.

In spite of an expected dip in profit, most analysts are positive about Amazon.com (AMZN) before it reports its fourth quarter earnings on Tuesday, January 29, 2013.Analysts are expecting Amazon.com to come in with earnings of 29 cents per share, 23.7% less than a year ago when it reported earnings of 38 cents per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from 50 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting a loss of 3 cents per share. Revenue is projected to be $22.28 billion for the quarter, 27.8% above the year-earlier total of $17.43 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $62.1 billion.The company has seen double-digit year-over-year revenue growth for the past four quarters. Over that span, the company has averaged growth of 31.2%, with the biggest boost coming in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year when revenue rose 34.6% from the year earlier quarter.Last quarter's loss snapped a streak of earnings in the previous three quarters. The company incurred a loss of $274 million in the most recent quarter. Going back three quarters before that, it reported a profit of $7 million in the second quarter, a profit of $130 million in the first and a profit of $177 million in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.

Wall Street is high on Broadcom (BRCM), expecting it to report earnings that are up 15.6% from a year ago when it reports its fourth quarter earnings on Tuesday, January 29, 2013. The consensus estimate is 52 cents per share, up from earnings of 45 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 55 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.01 per share. Revenue is projected to be 13.7% above the year-earlier total of $1.82 billion at $2.07 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $7.98 billion.Revenue has climbed in each of the last three quarters. The 8.7% revenue increase brought the figure up to $2.13 billion in the most recent quarter. Looking back further, revenue increased 9.7% in the second quarter from the year earlier and 0.6% in the first quarter.While being profitable for the last eight quarters, the company has seen net income slip over the past four quarters by an average of 23.3% year-over-year. The company weathered a blow in the first quarter when net income dropped 61.4%, marking the hardest-hit quarter.
The majority of analysts (89.5%) rate Broadcom as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest eight competitors, which average 42.4% buys. Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months. Even so, over the past quarter, the stock price has increased from $31.76 on October 26, 2012 to $34.74.

EMC (EMC) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Tuesday, January 29, 2013.The Wall Street consensus is 43 cents per share, up 2.4% from a year ago when EMC reported earnings of 42 cents per share.Despite not changing over the past month, the consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 44 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.37 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $5.57 billion by 7.3%, finishing at $5.98 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $21.66 billion.For three consecutive quarters, the company's net income has increased. In the most recent quarter, profit increased 3.4% year-over-year. Going back two quarters, net income rose 18.9% in the second quarter and 23% in the first quarter.The majority of analysts (84.4%) rate EMC as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest eight competitors, which average 24.3% buys. Analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.

Analysts have become increasingly bullish on Danaher (DHR) in the month leading up to the company's fourth quarter earnings announcement scheduled for Tuesday, January 29, 2013. The consensus earnings per share estimate has moved up from 83 cents a share to the current expectation of earnings of 87 cents a share.The current estimate reflects a 7.4% increase from a year ago, when the company reported earnings of 81 cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has increased from 82 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $3.18 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 6.5% above the year-earlier total of $4.52 billion at $4.81 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $18.09 billion.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the third quarter ended a streak of revenue growth that had lasted three quarters. Revenue fell 2.3% in the third quarter and rose 22.7%in the second quarter, 29% in the first quarter and 25.1% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, profit has risen year-over-year by an average of 15.1%. The largest gain for the company was seen in the first quarter, when net income swelled by 42.8%.

Analysts foresee Nucor (NUE) announcing decreased profits on Tuesday, January 29, 2013, when it reports its fourth quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are expecting Nucor to come in with earnings of 29 cents per share, down 21.6% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 37 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 37 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $1.64 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $4.83 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 5.8% year-over-year to $4.55 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $19.56 billion.The company has seen dips in its revenue in the last two quarters. In third quarter, revenue declined 8.6% to $4.8 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the second quarter, the figure fell 0.1%.The majority of analysts (64.3%) rate Nucor as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest nine competitors, which average 27.3% buys. Wall Street has warmed to the stock over the past three months, with the average analyst estimate increasing to moderate buy from hold. Last quarter, eight of 15 rated it a buy and one rated it a sell.

VMware (VMW) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Monday, January 28, 2013.The consensus estimate is 54 cents per share, up 3.8% from a year ago when Vmware reported earnings of 52 cents per share.The consensus estimate is up from three months ago when it was 52 cents, but hasn't changed over the past month. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.01 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 20.7% above the year-earlier total of $1.06 billion at $1.28 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.59 billion.The company has enjoyed double-digit year-over-year percentage revenue growth for the past four quarters. Over that time span, revenue has increased by an average of 23.6%, with the largest growth in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year when it rose 26.9% year-over-year.Net income has decreased in each of the last two quarters. In the most recent quarter, profit dipped 11.7% year-over-year, and the figure dropped 12.9% in the second quarter.The majority of analysts (61.3%) rate Vmware as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 59.7% buys. Analyst sentiment has improved recently, as the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. Consequently, over the past quarter the stock price has increased from $86.36 on October 25, 2012 to $92.78.

Expectations have dropped for Caterpillar's (CAT) fourth quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Monday, January 28, 2013. The consensus analyst estimate has dropped from $1.72 a share to the current estimate of earnings of $1.70 a share.The current estimate reflects a 26.7% decrease from the year-ago quarter, when Caterpillar reported earnings of $2.32 per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has sagged from $1.77. Analysts are projecting earnings of $9.14 per share for the fiscal year. After being $17.24 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 6.3% year-over-year to $16.16 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $65.8 billion.For three straight quarters, the company has seen net income rise. The 48.9% year-over-year growth in net income in the most recent quarter came after the 67.4% profit growth in the second quarter and the 29.5% rise in the first quarter.Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Caterpillar, with 11 of 20 analysts rating it hold. Analyst sentiment has improved recently, as the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.

Yahoo! (YHOO) is just 42 cents off from its 52-week high of $20.32 per share as it prepares to report its fourth quarter earnings on Monday, January 28, 2013.The consensus estimate is 27 cents per share, up 8% from a year ago when Yahoo! reported earnings of 25 cents per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.07 per share. Analysts project revenue to fall 8.6% year-over-year to $1.21 billion for the quarter, after being $1.32 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.46 billion.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of more than threefold. The company enjoyed the boost in the most recent quarter when net income expanded 977.5%, marking the biggest gain.The company's revenue declined in each of the last two quarters. In third quarter, revenue declined 1.2% to $1.2 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the second quarter, the figure fell 0.9%.Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Yahoo!, with 20 of 25 analysts rating it hold. Analyst sentiment has improved recently, as the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. As a result, over the past quarter, the stock price has risen to $19.90 from $16.61 on October 25, 2012.

Analysts foresee Halliburton (HAL) announcing decreased profits on Friday, January 25, 2013, when it reports its fourth quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are projecting Halliburton to come in with earnings of 61 cents per share, 39% less than a year ago when it reported earnings of $1 per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was 63 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.97 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts project revenue to fall 0.1% year-over-year to $7.06 billion for the quarter, after being $7.06 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $28.27 billion.The company has seen decreasing net income for the last two quarters. In the third quarter, net income fell 11.9% from the year earlier quarter, while the figure dropped 0.3% in the second quarter.The majority of analysts (74.1%) rate Halliburton as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 66% buys. There has been a decrease in optimism about the stock among analysts over the last three months. The stock price has increased from $33.47 on October 23, 2012 to $37.50 over the past quarter.

Leading up to Weyerhaeuser's (WY) announcement of its fourth quarter earnings on Friday, January 25, 2013, analysts have become more bullish as expectations have improved over the past month from 16 cents per share to the current projection of earnings of 19 cents per share.The current Wall Street consensus is 35.7% higher than the year-ago quarter, when the company reported earnings of 14 cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has risen from 14 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of 51 cents per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $1.61 billion by 11.5%, finishing at $1.8 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $6.83 billion.The company has seen increasing revenue for two consecutive quarters. In third quarter, revenue increased 12.9% to $1.77 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the second quarter, the figure rose 11.4%.Analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. Consequently, over the past quarter the stock price has increased from $27.87 on October 23, 2012 to $30.63.

Honeywell (HON) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Friday, January 25, 2013.The Wall Street consensus is $1.09 per share, up 3.8% from a year ago when Honeywell reported earnings of $1.05 per share.Despite not changing over the past month, the consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was $1.15. Analysts are expecting earnings of $4.48 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be $9.51 billion for the quarter, 0.4% above the year-earlier total of $9.47 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $37.6 billion.

Despite an expected dip in profit, analysts are generally optimistic about Covidien (COV) as it prepares to reports its first quarter earnings on Friday, January 25, 2013.Analysts are projecting Covidien to come in with earnings of $1.06 per share, 6.2% less than a year ago when it reported earnings of $1.13 per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was $1.08. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $4.42 per share. Revenue is expected to be $3 billion for the quarter, 3.5% higher than the year-earlier total of $2.9 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $12.38 billion.Revenue dropped year-over-year in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, breaking the three-quarter streak of revenue growth. The 2.5% revenue decline in the most recent quarter can be compared with three quarters prior when it had been rising. It increased 2.8%in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, 5.2% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year and 4.7% in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, profit has risen year-over-year by an average of 3%. The largest gain for the company was seen in the first quarter of the last fiscal year, when net income swelled by 15.7%.

Analysts expect decreased profit for Xerox (XRX) when the company reports its fourth quarter results on Thursday, January 24, 2013. Although Xerox reported profit of 33 cents a year ago, the consensus estimate calls for earnings per share of 28 cents.Despite not changing over the past month, the consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 34 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.03 per share. Revenue is projected to be 1.2% above the year-earlier total of $5.81 billion at $5.88 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $22.35 billion.For three consecutive quarters, the company has seen net income decrease. Net income fell 11.9% in the third quarter. Going back two quarters, profit decreased 3.1% in the second quarter and 4.3% in the first quarter.A two-quarter streak of rising revenue was snapped by the revenue decline in the third quarter. Revenue declined 0.1% in the most recent quarter. Prior to that, revenue had been increasing; it rose 1.7% in the second quarter and 3.8% in the first quarter.

Expectations have dropped for Amgen's (AMGN) fourth quarter results in the month leading up to the company's earnings announcement slated for Thursday, January 24, 2013. The consensus analyst estimate has dropped from $1.47 a share to the current estimate of earnings of $1.43 a share.Analysts are estimating a 20.2% increase from the year-ago quarter, when Amgen reported earnings of $1.19 per share.The consensus estimate has increased from $1.39 over the past three months. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $6.49 per share. Revenue is expected to be $4.37 billion for the quarter, 10% higher than the year-earlier total of $3.97 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $17.21 billion.The company has posted increasing profit for three quarters in a row. The more than twofold year-over-year growth in net income in the most recent quarter came after the 8.2% profit growth in the second quarter and the 5.2% rise in the first quarter.Analysts are split on Amgen, but 13 of 26 analysts rate it hold. The past three months have seen Wall Street analysts become less optimistic about Amgen. The stock price has fallen 4.4% since October 22, 2012, from $87.80 to $83.94.
Amgen's current dividend yield is 2.2% based on Thursday's close of $82.15. The company has an annualized dividend of $1.88 per share.

Wall Street is optimistic about Starbucks (SBUX), which is slated to report its first quarter results on Thursday, January 24, 2013. Analysts project a profit of 57 cents a share, a rise from 50 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate has risen from three months ago when it was 56 cents. It hasn't been adjusted since. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.15 per share. Revenue is projected to be 11.8% above the year-earlier total of $3.44 billion at $3.84 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $14.98 billion.The company has reported double-digit revenue increases for the past four quarters. Over that span, the company has averaged growth of 13.7%, with the biggest boost coming in the first quarter of the last fiscal year when revenue rose 16.4% from the year earlier quarter.The company has reported increasing profit for three straight quarters. In the most recent quarter, net income rose by 0.1% from the year-earlier period. Net income rose 19.3% in the quarter before that, and 18.5% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.
The majority of analysts (74.1%) rate Starbucks as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest seven competitors, which average 57.1% buys. Analyst sentiment about Starbucks has waned during the last three months. Still, the stock price has risen to $54.50 from $45.30 on October 22, 2012.Starbucks' current dividend yield is 1.5% based on Thursday's close of $54.50. The company has an annualized dividend of 84 cents per share.

Analysts foresee Microsoft (MSFT) announcing decreased profits on Thursday, January 24, 2013, when it reports its second quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are projecting Microsoft to come in with earnings of 76 cents per share, down 2.6% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 78 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 86 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.87 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be $21.63 billion for the quarter, 3.6% above the year-earlier total of $20.89 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $79.86 billion.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the first quarter broke a three-quarter streak of revenue increases. Revenue fell 7.9% in the first quarter and rose 4%in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, 6% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 4.7% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts (60%) rate Microsoft as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest nine competitors, which average 50.2% buys. Analysts have grown increasingly optimistic about the stock in the last three months. Even so, since October 22, 2012, the stock price has dipped 2.7% to $27.25 from $28.

Analysts are looking for decreased profit for Raytheon (RTN) when the company reports its results for the fourth quarter on Thursday, January 24, 2013. Raytheon reported profit of $1.74 a year ago, but the consensus estimate calls for earnings per share of $1.30 this time around.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was $1.33, but is unchanged over the past month. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $5.54 per share. A year after being $6.44 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 0.5% year-over-year to $6.41 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $24.39 billion.The decrease in profit in the third quarter broke a streak of three consecutive quarters of year-over-year profit increases. Profit dropped 0.2% year-over-year in the most recent quarter. Going further back, the figure rose 7.5% in the second quarter, 16.7% in the first quarter and 18.3% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.For the last four quarters, the company has reported decreasing revenue. Revenue declined 1.4% to $6.04 billion in third quarter. The figure fell 3.7% in the second quarter from the year earlier, dropped 2% in first quarter from the year-ago quarter and 6.4% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.
Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Raytheon, with 10 of 17 analysts rating it hold. Analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months.

KeyCorp (KEY) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Thursday, January 24, 2013.Analysts are expecting KeyCorp to report earnings of 22 cents per share, up 4.8% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 21 cents per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of 89 cents per share. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 5.6% year-over-year to $1.05 billion for the quarter, after being $1.11 billion a year ago. The 19% profit drop in the most recent quarter can be compared with two previous quarters of profit growth: 7% in the third quarter and 5% in the second quarter.Over the last four quarters, revenue has increased 3% on average year-over-year. In the second quarter, the company saw its greatest gain in revenue, when it increased 4% from the year-earlier quarter.

SLM (SLM) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Wednesday, January 16, 2013.The Wall Street consensus is 53 cents per share, up 3.9% from a year ago when SLM reported earnings of 51 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 57 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.15 per share. A year after being $1.88 billion, analysts expect revenue to fall 62.1% year-over-year to $711 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $2.81 billion.The company has seen improved revenue in the last two quarters. In the most recent quarter, revenue rose 25.6% year-over-year to $1.37 billion. The quarter before that, it rose 45.2%.

Wall Street is optimistic about eBay (EBAY), which is slated to report its fourth quarter results on Wednesday, January 16, 2013. Analysts project a profit of 61 cents a share, a rise from 55 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has increased from three months ago when it was 60 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.05 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $3.38 billion by 17.5%, finishing at $3.97 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $14.05 billion.In each of the last four quarters, the company has seen double-digit year-over-year revenue growth. Over that time span, revenue has increased by an average of 25.5%, with the largest growth in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year when it rose 35.5% year-over-year.The company's net income has been increasing for three consecutive quarters. In the most recent quarter, net income rose by 21.7% from the year-earlier period. Net income rose more than twofold in the quarter before that, and 19.8% in the first quarter.

Comerica (CMA) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Wednesday, January 16, 2013.The Wall Street consensus is 64 cents per share, up 6.7% from a year ago when Comerica reported earnings of 60 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.65 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 6.4% year-over-year to $620.3 million for the quarter, after being $663 million a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $2.54 billion.The company's profit has been on the rise for three quarters in a row. In the most recent quarter, profit increased 19.4% year-over-year. Going back two quarters, net income rose 50% in the second quarter and 26.2% in the first quarter.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the third quarter broke a three-quarter streak of revenue increases. The 1.1% revenue decline in the most recent quarter can be compared with three quarters prior when it had been rising. It increased 7.6%in the second quarter, 6.7% in the first quarter and 0.5% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.

Analysts expect higher profit for Lennar (LEN) when the company reports its fourth quarter results on Tuesday, January 15, 2013. The consensus estimate is calling for profit of 43 cents a share, reflecting a rise from 16 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's up from three months ago when it was 42 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.98 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $1.32 billion for the quarter, 38.6% higher than the year-earlier total of $952.7 million. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $4.07 billion.For the last two quarters, the company has seen an uptick in revenue. In third quarter, revenue increased 34.1% to $1.1 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the second quarter, the figure rose 21.7%.The majority of analysts think investors should stand pat on Lennar, with eight of 16 analysts rating it hold. Analysts have become more cautious about the stock in the last three months. Even so, over the past quarter, the stock price has increased from $35.76 on October 12, 2012 to $41.71.

Analysts expect higher profit for Monsanto (MON) when the company reports its first quarter results on Tuesday, January 8, 2013. The consensus estimate is calling for profit of 36 cents a share, reflecting a rise from 23 cents per share a year ago.For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $4.38 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $2.44 billion by 8.2%, finishing at $2.64 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $14.6 billion.Monsanto's three-quarter streak of profitability was snapped by last quarter's loss. The past quarter, the company lost $229 million. Prior to that, it reported a profit of $937 million in the third quarter of the last fiscal year, a profit of $1.21 billion in the second of the last fiscal year and a profit of $126 million in the first quarter of the last fiscal year.Revenue dropped in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, following an increase in the previous quarter. The 7.2% drop in the most recent quarter brought revenue down to $2.11 billion. The quarter before that, revenue rose 17.5%.

Leading up to Mosaic's (MOS) announcement of its second quarter earnings on Friday, January 4, 2013 analysts have become more wary as expectations have fallen over the past month to earnings of 98 cents per share from earnings of $1 per share.Current Wall Street estimates reflect a 30% decline from the year-ago quarter, when the company reported earnings of $1.40 per share.The consensus estimate has dipped over the past three months from $1.33. Analysts are expecting earnings of $4.50 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts project revenue to fall 15.7% year-over-year to $2.54 billion for the quarter, after being $3.01 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $9.63 billion.The last three quarters have brought the company decreased reveue. Revenue in first quarter fell 18.8% year-over-year to $2.51 billion. The figure dropped 1.4% in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and 1.1% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, but income has been falling for the last four by an average of 32.3% year-over-year. The company was hit the hardest in the third quarter of the last fiscal year as it saw profit drop by 49.6%.

Analysts are expecting earnings of 89 cents per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be $773.3 million for the quarter, 4% above the year-earlier total of $744.9 million. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $2.97 billion.A year-over-year revenue decrease in the first quarter snapped a streak of three consecutive quarters of revenue increases.100% of analysts rate Steelcase as a buy. All three analysts rate Steelcase as a buy.Other companies in the consumer cyclical sector reporting earnings soon are Herman Miller, 
 
Knoll
 and HNI. Herman Miller is expected to report earnings of 45 cents per share on Wednesday, September 18, 2013, Knoll is expected to report earnings of 34 cents per share on Wednesday, September 18, 2013 and HNI is expected to report earnings of 44 cents per share on Wednesday, September 18, 2013.

Leading up to Walgreen's (WAG) announcement of its first quarter earnings on Friday, December 21, 2012 analysts have become more wary as expectations have fallen over the past month to earnings of 67 cents per share from earnings of 70 cents per share.The current estimate reflects a 6.3% increase from a year ago, when the company reported earnings of 63 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.21 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue dropped by 5% year-over-year to $17.07 billion in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year. The quarter before that, revenue dropped 3.4%.

Optimism surrounds Cintas (CTAS), as it gets ready to report its second quarter results on Thursday, December 20, 2012. Analysts are expecting the company to book a profit of 63 cents a share, up from 57 cents a year ago.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's up from three months ago when it was 61 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $2.55 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $1.06 billion for the quarter, 4% higher than the year-earlier total of $1.02 billion. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $4.27 billion.The company has seen net income rise in three straight quarters. In the most recent quarter, net income rose by 11.8% from the year-earlier period. Net income rose 11.1% in the quarter before that, and 28.7% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Cintas, with eight of 10 analysts rating it hold.

Nike (NKE) reports its second quarter earnings on Thursday, December 20, 2012.Analysts are projecting earnings of $1 per share, matching that number from a year ago.Over the past month, the consensus estimate has jumped from 99 cents, but it's below the estimate of $1.01 from three months ago. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $5.24 per share. Revenue is projected to be $5.99 billion for the quarter, 4.5% above the year-earlier total of $5.73 billion. Nike's average analyst rating hasn't changed over the past three months. Despite the even keel, stock price has fallen 0.8% to $96.91 from $97.72 since September 18, 2012.Nike designs and markets footwear, apparel and athletic equipment. One of Nike's main competitors in the footwear industry is K Swiss Inc (KSWS). Other competitors in the consumer cyclical sector include: Crocs (CROX), Deckers Outdoor Corp (DECK), and Skechers USA (SKX).

CarMax (KMX) reports its third quarter earnings on Thursday, December 20, 2012.Analysts are expecting CarMax to report earnings of 39 cents per share, up 8.3% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 36 cents per share.Over the past month, the consensus estimate has risen from 38 cents, but it's the same as the estimate from three months ago. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.83 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $2.26 billion by 8.8%, finishing at $2.46 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $10.65 billion.The company has seen net income fall in each of the last two quarters. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest seven competitors, which average 41.7% buys. Analysts have grown increasingly optimistic about the stock in the last three months.

Paychex (PAYX) reports its second quarter earnings on Wednesday, December 19, 2012.The consensus estimate is 40 cents per share, up 2.6% from a year ago when Paychex reported earnings of 39 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 41 cents. Net income rose 3.7% in the quarter before that, and 3.7% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Paychex, with 17 of 22 analysts rating it hold.

Accenture (ACN) reports its first quarter earnings on Wednesday, December 19, 2012.The Wall Street consensus is $1.04 per share, up 8.3% from a year ago when Accenture reported earnings of 96 cents per share.The consensus estimate has risen from three months ago when it was $1.01. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest nine competitors, which average 44.5% buys. Analyst sentiment has waned during the last three months.

In spite of an expected dip in profit, most analysts are positive about FedEx (FDX) before it reports its second quarter earnings on Wednesday, December 19, 2012.Analysts are expecting FedEx to come in with earnings of $1.40 per share, 10.8% less than a year ago when it reported earnings of $1.57 per share.The consensus estimate has dipped over the past three months from $1.67. In the most recent quarter, revenue rose 2.6% year-over-year to $10.79 billion. The quarter before that, it rose 4.3%.

Oracle (ORCL) reports its second quarter earnings on Tuesday, December 18, 2012.Analysts are expecting Oracle to report earnings of 58 cents per share, up 9.4% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 53 cents per share.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 59 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.53 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $8.79 billion by 2.7%, finishing at $9.03 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $38.29 billion.For three consecutive quarters, the company's net income has increased. In the first quarter, net income rose 10.5% while it rose 7.6% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and 18.1% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.A year-over-year drop in revenue in the first quarter broke a three-quarter streak of revenue increases. The 2.3% revenue decline in the most recent quarter can be compared with three quarters prior when it had been rising. It increased 1.3%in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, 3.1% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 2.4% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.

American Eagle Outfitters reports its first-quarter earnings on Wednesday, May 21, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is zero cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 13 cents. column4: Wal-Mart Stores reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, May 15, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is $1.15 per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was $1.25. Analysts are expecting earnings of $5.30 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 2% above the year-earlier total of $114.19 billion at $116.29 billion for the quarter. In the fourth quarter, revenue increased 14% to $129.71 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the third quarter, the figure rose 2%.For three consecutive quarters, the company's net income has increased. In the most recent quarter, profit increased 17% year-over-year. Going back two quarters, net income rose 3% in the third quarter and 1% in the second quarter.

SAIC (SAI) reports its third quarter earnings on Wednesday, December 5, 2012.Analysts are projecting earnings of 35 cents per share, which is the exact same as a year ago.Over the past month the consensus estimate has gone up, from 34 cents, but it's the same as the estimate from three months ago. Wall Street analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. Even so, since September 4, 2012, the stock price has dipped 3.6% to $11.67 from $12.10.SAIC's current dividend yield is 4.2% based on Wednesday's close of $11.67. The company has an annualized dividend of 48 cents per share.

Wall Street is expecting higher profit for AutoZone (AZO) when the company reports its first quarter results on Tuesday, December 4, 2012. AutoZone's rating hasn't budged in three months as the average analyst rating of the stock has remained steady. Despite this, the stock price has risen to $383.86 from $361.64 on August 31, 2012.

column4:
Beam
 reports its second quarter earnings on Thursday, August 8, 2013, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 60 cents per share.The consensus estimate has dipped over the past three months from 61 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.65 per share. Revenue is projected to be 6% above the year-earlier total of $595.5 million at $628.6 million for the quarter. The company was hit the hardest in the third quarter as it saw profit drop by 81%.Revenue has decreased for the past three quarters. Revenue in the first quarter fell 3% year-over-year to $577.7 million. The figure dropped more than twofold in the fourth quarter and 56% in the third quarter.

Analysts are generally bullish on Beam, as seven analysts rate it as a buy and only one analyst rates it as a sell. Three months ago, these numbers were six and one, respectively.

CenturyLink
 reports its second quarter earnings on Wednesday, August 7, 2013, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 67 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's up from three months ago when it was 66 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.74 per share. After being $4.61 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 2% year-over-year to $4.53 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $18.12 billion.Revenue has dropped for the past three quarters. Revenue in the first quarter fell 2% year-over-year to $4.51 billion. The figure dropped 2% in the fourth quarter and 1% in the third quarter.Over the last four quarters, the company has seen its income grow by an average of more than twofold year-over-year. The more than fourfold increase in the most recent quarter was the biggest rise.Analysts are split on CenturyLink, but six of 18 analysts rate it hold.

In spite of an expected dip in profit, most analysts are positive about Target (TGT) before it reports its third quarter earnings on Thursday, November 15, 2012.Analysts are projecting Target to come in with earnings of 77 cents per share, 6.1% less than a year ago when it reported earnings of 82 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's up from three months ago when it was 76 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $4.40 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $16.93 billion for the quarter, 3.2% higher than the year-earlier total of $16.4 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $73.2 billion.

Analysts are looking for decreased profit for Dell (DELL) when the company reports its results for the third quarter on Thursday, November 15, 2012. Dell reported profit of 54 cents a year ago, but the consensus estimate calls for earnings per share of 40 cents this time around.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was 49 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.74 per share. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 9.5% year-over-year to $13.91 billion for the quarter, after being $15.37 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $57.43 billion.The company has seen net income fall in each of the last three quarters. In second quarter, net income fell 17.8% from the year earlier, while the figure fell 32.8% in the first quarter and 17.6% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.Revenue has been falling the past two quarters. In second quarter, revenue was $14.48 billion, 7.5% lower than the year-ago figure. In the quarter before that, revenue fell 4%.Most analysts think investors should stand pat on Dell, with 14 of 26 analysts rating it hold. Wall Street analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. Even so, since August 14, 2012, the stock price has dipped 22.8% to $9.41 from $12.19.

Analysts have become increasingly bullish on Gap (GPS) in the month leading up to the company's third quarter earnings announcement scheduled for Thursday, November 15, 2012. The consensus earnings per share estimate has moved up from 54 cents a share to the current expectation of earnings of 63 cents a share.Wall Street estimates are up 65.8% from a year ago, when Gap reported earnings of 38 cents per share.The consensus estimate has gone up, from 51 cents, over the past three months. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.25 per share. Revenue is projected to be 6.6% above the year-earlier total of $3.58 billion at $3.82 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $15.53 billion.

Intuit (INTU) is expected to book a narrower loss than a year ago when it reports first quarter earnings on Thursday, November 15, 2012 with analysts expecting a loss of 17 cents per share, up from a loss of 18 cents per share a year ago.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has fallen from a loss of 16 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $2.95 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $594 million by 7.6%, finishing at $639.2 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $4.59 billion.Over the last four quarters, revenue rose 8.2% on average year-over-year. The biggest boost came in the second quarter of the last fiscal year, when revenue increased 16.1% from the year-ago quarter.The majority of analysts (62.5%) rate Intuit as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 55% buys. Analyst sentiment has improved recently, as the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. As a result, over the past quarter, the stock price has risen to $59.96 from $58.02 on August 14, 2012.

Analysts expect decreased profit for GameStop (GME) when the company reports its third quarter results on Thursday, November 15, 2012. Although GameStop reported profit of 39 cents a year ago, the consensus estimate calls for earnings per share of 32 cents.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has sagged from 41 cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of $3.14 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts project revenue to fall 8.1% year-over-year to $1.79 billion for the quarter, after being $1.95 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $9.01 billion.

NetApp (NTAP) is expected to report poor second quarter earnings on Wednesday, November 14, 2012 with analysts expecting a 34% drop in earnings from a year ago. The consensus estimate is 33 cents per share, down from earnings of 50 cents per share a year ago.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has fallen from 34 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.45 per share. Revenue is projected to be 2.2% above the year-earlier total of $1.51 billion at $1.54 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $6.37 billion.A year-over-year dip in revenue in the first quarter broke a three-quarter streak of revenue growth.. The 0.9% revenue decline in the most recent quarter can be compared with three quarters prior when it had been rising. It increased 12.8%in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year, 23.5% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year and 24.8% in the second quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has seen profit decline in each of the last three quarters. Net income dropped 54.3% year-over-year in the most recent quarter. Profit had already been falling in previous quarters: 7% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and 30.7% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.

Staples (SPLS) is expected to report poor third quarter earnings on Wednesday, November 14, 2012 with analysts expecting a 4.3% drop in earnings from a year ago. The consensus estimate is 45 cents per share, down from earnings of 47 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was 49 cents. Analysts are expecting earnings of $1.36 per share for the fiscal year. After being $6.57 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 1.7% year-over-year to $6.46 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $24.76 billion.Profit has dropped year-over-year in each of the last two quarters. The company posted profit falling by 31.7% in the second quarter. This is after it reported a profit decline in the first quarter by 5.6%.The company's revenue declined in each of the last two quarters. Revenue dropped by 5.5% year-over-year to $5.5 billion in second quarter. The quarter before that, revenue dropped 1.1%.The majority of analysts think investors should stand pat on Staples, with eight of 15 analysts rating it hold. Wall Street analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. The stock price has fallen 15.5% since August 13, 2012, from $13.36 to $11.29.

Hartford Financial Services reports its first-quarter earnings on Monday, April 28, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 93 cents per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from 96 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $3.62 per share. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 39% year-over-year to $5.60 billion for the quarter, after being $9.18 billion a year ago. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $21.84 billion.Over the last four quarters, the company saw a year-over-year drop in revenue by an average of 2%. The biggest fall was in the most recent quarter, when it fell 34% from the year-earlier quarter.
column6: Forbes Earnings Preview: Hartford Financial Services

column4: Saks (SKS) reports its third quarter earnings on Tuesday, November 13, 2012.The consensus estimate is 12 cents per share, up 9.1% from a year ago when Saks reported earnings of 11 cents per share.Analysts are projecting earnings of 49 cents per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $725.7 million for the quarter, 4.8% higher than the year-earlier total of $692.3 million. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $3.2 billion.Saks' loss in the most recent quarter snapped a three-quarter earnings streak. The past quarter, the company lost $12.3 million. Prior to that, it reported a profit of $32.1 million in the first quarter, a profit of $37 million in the fourth of the last fiscal year and a profit of $17.8 million in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.Revenue grew in the last two quarters. In second quarter, revenue increased 5.1% to $704.1 million from the year earlier quarter. In the first quarter, the figure rose 3.8%.The majority of analysts think investors should stand pat on Saks, with six of 10 analysts rating it hold. Wall Street analysts have become more optimistic about the stock recently and the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. Despite this, the stock price has fallen 6.9% to $10.24 from $11 since August 10, 2012.

Unum reports its second quarter earnings on Monday, August 5, 2013, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is 80 cents per share.Analysts are expecting earnings of $3.24 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts are projecting revenue this quarter to stay static at $2.61 billion. After being $2.62 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop less than a percent year-over-year to $2.61 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $10.45 billion.Over the last four quarters, the company has seen its revenue grow by an average of 2% year-over-year. The 3% increase in the third quarter was the biggest rise.

In the month leading up to the Ameren's (AEE) third quarter earnings announcement slated for Friday, November 9, 2012, expectations have risen for the upcoming results. Analysts are expecting earnings of $2.47 per share for the fiscal year. After being $2.27 billion a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 5.6% year-over-year to $2.14 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $7.4 billion.The company's reported revenue has declined in each of the last three quarters. In second quarter, revenue declined 6.8% to $1.66 billion while the figure fell 12.9% in first quarter from the year earlier and 10.5% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.Analysts generally think investors should stand pat on Ameren, with eight of 10 analysts rating it hold. Analyst sentiment has improved recently, as the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. The stock price has fallen 6.4% since August 8, 2012, from $34.45 to $32.25.

In spite of an expected dip in profit, most analysts are positive about Covidien (COV) before it reports its fourth quarter earnings on Friday, November 9, 2012.Analysts are projecting Covidien to come in with earnings of $1 per share, down 7.4% from a year ago when it reported earnings of $1.08 per share.Despite not changing over the past month, the consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was $1.02. Analysts are expecting earnings of $4.24 per share for the fiscal year. Analysts look for revenue to decrease 3.2% year-over-year to $2.98 billion for the quarter, after being $3.08 billion a year ago. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest eight competitors, which average 40.2% buys. Analyst sentiment has improved recently, as the number of buy ratings has risen slightly over the past three months. Even so, since August 8, 2012, the stock price has dipped 2.1% to $55.65 from $56.87.

New York Times reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 24, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is four cents per share.The consensus estimate has risen from three months ago when it was three cents. It hasn't been adjusted since. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of 40 cents per share. After being $465.9 million a year ago, analysts project revenue to drop 17% year-over-year to $384.7 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $1.59 billion.The company has reported falling revenue for four quarters in a row. In the fourth quarter, revenue fell 5% to $443.9 million. Prior to that, the figure declined 19% year-over-year in the third quarter, fell 6% in the second quarter and slid 7% in the first quarter.

column4: Sirius XM Radio reports its first-quarter earnings on Thursday, April 24, 2014, and the consensus earnings per share estimate is two cents per share.The consensus estimate remains unchanged over the past month, but it has decreased from three months ago when it was three cents. Analysts are projecting earnings of 10 cents per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be 11% above the year-earlier total of $897.4 million at $994.6 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $4.13 billion.The company has reported double-digit revenue increases for the past four quarters. Over that span, the company has averaged growth of 12%, with the biggest boost coming in the second quarter when revenue rose 12% from the year earlier quarter.Over the last four quarters, the company saw a year-over-year drop in revenue by an average of 12%. The biggest fall was in the third quarter, when it fell 11% from the year-earlier quarter.The majority of analysts (70%) rate Sirius XM as a buy. Analysts expect higher profit for Wendy's (WEN) when the company reports its third quarter results on Thursday, November 8, 2012. The biggest gain came in the first quarter of the last fiscal year with a 76.3% surge.Revenue rose in the last two quarters. In the most recent quarter, revenue rose 0.4% year-over-year to $968 million. The quarter before that, it rose 6%.The majority of analysts (66.7%) rate CareFusion as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 60.2% buys. CareFusion's average analyst rating hasn't changed over the past three months. Analysts expect higher profit for Nordstrom (JWN) when the company reports its third quarter results on Thursday, November 8, 2012. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $3.49 per share. Revenue is expected to be $2.8 billion for the quarter, 13% higher than the year-earlier total of $2.48 billion. Net income dropped 19.7% year-over-year in the most recent quarter. The 3.7% increase in the third quarter of the last fiscal year was the biggest rise.The majority of analysts (58.8%) rate Kohl's as a buy. Despite this, the stock price has risen from $28.49 on August 7, 2012 to $29.19 over the past quarter.

Revenue is projected to be 4.7% above the year-earlier total of $1.64 billion at $1.72 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $5.65 billion.The company's reported revenue has fallen in the last four quarters. Revenue declined 16.3% to $1.18 billion in second quarter. The figure fell 20.9% in the first quarter from the year earlier, dropped 18.7% in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year from the year-ago quarter and 20.5% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.The company has seen steady earnings for the last eight quarters, and for the last four, net income has increased year-over-year by an average of 75.1%. The company enjoyed the boost in the third quarter of the last fiscal year when net income expanded more than fourfold, marking the biggest gain.

OfficeMax (OMX) is hoping its third quarter earnings report on Tuesday, November 6, 2012 will help continue the momentum its stock price has enjoyed. Shares have risen 49.4% over the last three months to close at $7.35 on October 31, 2012.Analysts are expecting OfficeMax to report earnings of 26 cents per share, up 4% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 25 cents per share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has increased from 25 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of 75 cents per share. Revenue is expected to be $1.78 billion for the quarter, 0.3% higher than the year-earlier total of $1.77 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $7.04 billion.A year-over-year revenue decline in the second quarter came after two consecutive quarters of revenue increases. Revenue declined 2.7% in the most recent quarter. Prior to that, revenue had been increasing; it rose 0.5% in the first quarter and 3.9% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts think investors should stand pat on OfficeMax, with five of nine analysts rating it hold. That rating hasn't budged in three months as the average analyst rating of the stock has remained constant.

Analysts expect higher profit for DIRECTV (DTV) when the company reports its third quarter results on Tuesday, November 6, 2012. The consensus estimate is calling for profit of 92 cents a share, reflecting a rise from 70 cents per share a year ago.The consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 96 cents, but is unchanged over the past month. Analysts are expecting earnings of $4.23 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is projected to be $7.41 billion for the quarter, 8.3% above the year-earlier total of $6.84 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $29.73 billion.For three straight quarters, the company has seen net income rise. The 1.4% year-over-year growth in net income in the most recent quarter came after the 8.5% profit growth in the first quarter and the 16.2% rise in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts (61.9%) rate DIRECTV as a buy. That percentage is still below the mean analyst rating of its nearest seven competitors, which average 63.9% buys. The average analyst rating of the stock has stayed unchanged from three months prior. Even so, over the past quarter the stock price has increased from $50.16 on August 3, 2012 to $51.14.

Analysts are looking for decreased profit for SYSCO (SYY) when the company reports its results for the first quarter on Monday, November 5, 2012. SYSCO reported profit of 55 cents a year ago, but the consensus estimate calls for earnings per share of 50 cents this time around.The consensus estimate has risen from three months ago when it was 48 cents. It hasn't been adjusted since. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $2.01 per share. Revenue is projected to be 5.2% above the year-earlier total of $10.59 billion at $11.14 billion for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $44.55 billion.While the company has been profitable for the last eight quarters, income has fallen year-over-year by an average of 2.4% over the past four quarters. The company weathered a blow in the most recent quarter when net income dropped 8%, marking the hardest-hit quarter.Most analysts think investors should stand pat on SYSCO, with seven of 10 analysts rating it hold. SYSCO's rating hasn't budged in three months as the average analyst rating of the stock has remained steadfast. Despite this, the stock price has risen to $30.86 from $28.80 on August 2, 2012.
SYSCO's current dividend yield is 3.5% based on Monday's close of $31.07. The company has an annualized dividend of $1.08 per share.

Analysts foresee Humana (HUM) announcing decreased profits on Monday, November 5, 2012, when it reports its third quarter earnings. Despite this, they are generally optimistic about the stock.Analysts are projecting Humana to come in with earnings of $2.05 per share, down 19.3% from a year ago when it reported earnings of $2.54 per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past month, from $2.06, but it's the same as it was three months ago. Analysts are expecting earnings of $7.15 per share for the fiscal year. Revenue is expected to be $9.86 billion for the quarter, 6% higher than the year-earlier total of $9.3 billion. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $39.34 billion.The last two quarters have seen decreases in the company's net income. The company posted profit falling by 22.7% in the second quarter. This is after it reported a profit decline in the first quarter by 21.3%.The majority of analysts (65.2%) rate Humana as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest 10 competitors, which average 45.4% buys. There has been a decrease in optimism about the stock among analysts over the last three months. Even so, over the past quarter, the stock price has increased from $62.88 on August 2, 2012 to $74.47.
Humana's current dividend yield is 1.4% based on Monday's close of $74.27. The company has an annualized dividend of $1.04 per share.

Leading up to IntercontinentalExchange's (ICE) announcement of its third quarter earnings on Monday, November 5, 2012 analysts have become more wary as expectations have fallen over the past month to earnings of $1.72 per share from earnings of $1.83 per share.Current Wall Street estimates reflect a 8% decline from the year-ago quarter, when the company reported earnings of $1.87 per share.The consensus estimate has fallen over the past three months, from $1.90. Analysts are projecting earnings of $7.57 per share for the fiscal year. A year after being $340.8 million, analysts expect revenue to fall 4.6% year-over-year to $325.1 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $1.38 billion.The company's net income has been increasing for three consecutive quarters. In the second quarter, net income rose 18% while it rose 14.7% in the first quarter and 27.9% in the fourth quarter of the last fiscal year.The majority of analysts (75%) rate IntercontinentalExchange as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest nine competitors, which average 42.5% buys. Analysts have grown increasingly optimistic about the stock in the last three months. The stock price has thus risen from $128.71 on August 2, 2012 to $131.19 over the past quarter.

After AOL (AOL) experienced a loss of 7 cents a year ago, analysts predict positive news when the company reports this year's third quarter numbers on Tuesday, November 6, 2012. They expect a profit of 17 cents a share.Over the past three months, the consensus estimate has fallen from 18 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are expecting earnings of $11.23 per share. A year after being $531.7 million, analysts expect revenue to fall 1.9% year-over-year to $521.6 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $2.15 billion.Revenue has decreased in each of the last four quarters. In second quarter, revenue fell 2% to $531.1 million. Prior to that, the figure declined 4% year-over-year in the first quarter, fell 6% in fourth quarter of the last fiscal year and slid 5.6% in the third quarter of the last fiscal year.Analysts are split on AOL, but four of 10 analysts rate it hold. Analyst sentiment about AOL has waned during the last three months. Despite this, the stock price has risen from $32.63 on August 3, 2012 to $34.34 over the past quarter.

Qualcomm (QCOM) reports its fourth quarter earnings on Wednesday, November 7, 2012.Analysts are expecting QUALCOMM to report earnings of 70 cents per share, up 2.9% from a year ago when it reported earnings of 68 cents per share.Over the past month, the consensus estimate has fallen, from 71 cents, but it's the same as it was three months ago. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $3.19 per share. Revenue is projected to be $4.67 billion for the quarter, 13.4% above the year-earlier total of $4.12 billion. For the year, revenue is expected to come in at $18.91 billion.The company has enjoyed double-digit year-over-year percentage revenue growth for the past four quarters. Over that span, the company has averaged growth of 33.6%, with the biggest boost coming in the first quarter when revenue rose 39.8% from the year earlier quarter.The company's net income has been growing for three straight quarters. The 16.6% year-over-year growth in net income in the most recent quarter came after the more than twofold profit growth in the second quarter and the 19.7% rise in the first quarter.

Coach
 reports its fourth quarter earnings on Tuesday, July 30, 2013.The consensus estimate is 89 cents per share, up 3% from a year ago when Coachreported earnings of 86 cents per share.For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $3.73 per share. Revenue is expected to be $1.24 billion for the quarter, 7% higher than the year-earlier total of $1.16 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $5.09 billion.Revenue rose in the past two quarters. In the third quarter, revenue increased 3% to $1.19 billion from the year earlier quarter. In the second quarter, the figure rose 4%.The decrease in profit in the third quarter broke a streak of three consecutive quarters of year-over-year profit increases. Profit dropped 5% year-over-year in the most recent quarter. Going further back, the figure rose 2% in the second quarter, 3% in the first quarter and 24% in the fourth quarter.Competitors in the services sector include: Frederick's of Hollywood Group and Guess.

Corning
 reports its second quarter earnings on Tuesday, July 30, 2013.Analysts are projecting earnings of 31 cents per share, matching that number from a year ago.Despite not changing over the past month, the consensus estimate is down from three months ago when it was 32 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $1.30 per share. Revenue is expected to be $1.97 billion for the quarter, 3% higher than the year-earlier total of $1.91 billion. For the year, revenue is projected to come in at $8.05 billion.Over the last four quarters, revenue has fallen an average of 1% year-over-year. The biggest drop came in the most recent quarter, when revenue fell 5% from the year-earlier quarter.Revenue fell in the first quarter after seeing a rise the quarter before. The 5% drop in the most recent quarter brought revenue down to $1.81 billion. The quarter before that, revenue rose 14%.The majority of analysts (62%) rate Corning as a buy. That percentage is still below the mean analyst rating of its nearest six competitors, which average 64% buys. Analysts are generally bullish on Corning, as 10 analysts rate it as a buy and only one analyst rates it as a sell. Three months ago, these numbers were nine and two, respectively.

FMC
 reports its second quarter earnings on Monday, July 29, 2013.The consensus estimate is 94 cents per share, up 2% from a year ago when FMC reported earnings of 92 cents per share.The consensus estimate hasn't changed over the past month, but it's down from three months ago when it was 99 cents. For the fiscal year, analysts are projecting earnings of $3.97 per share. Revenue is projected to eclipse the year-earlier total of $905.2 million by 7%, finishing at $964.2 million for the quarter. For the year, revenue is projected to roll in at $4.12 billion.The company has seen increasing revenue for two consecutive quarters. In the most recent quarter, revenue rose 9% year-over-year to $990.2 million. The quarter before that, it rose 10%.Over the last four quarters, the company's income rose by an average of 14% year-over-year. The largest growth was in the fourth quarter, when income climbed 31% year-over-year.The majority of analysts (60%) rate FMC as a buy. This compares favorably to the analyst ratings of its nearest nine competitors, which average 46% buys.Competitors in the basic materials sector include: DuPont, 
 
Eastman Chemical
 and Rockwood Holdings.
